          <h2>

          <div class="box">

            <span class="date">
             July 28, 2018
            </span>
            <h3>
             Ana Popovic Likes It On Top: New Album Focuses on Empowered, Successful, Inspiring Female Role Models
            </h3>
            <a class="fancybox" href="/media/41372/screen_shot_2018-07-13_at_10.12.06_pm.png" title="Ana Popovic Likes It On Top: New Album Focuses on Empowered, Successful, Inspiring Female Role Models">
             <img alt="Ana Popovic Likes It On Top: New Album Focuses on Empowered, Successful, Inspiring Female Role Models" height="122" src="/media/41377/thmb_like.png" width="122"/>
            </a>
            <p>
            </p>
            <p class="p1">
             LOS ANGELESÂ â Guitarist, singerÂ AnaÂ Popovicâs ninth studio album, âLike It On Top,â inÂ which she explores various aspects of womenâs empowerment, will be releasedÂ worldwideÂ Sept. 14.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             Recorded inÂ Nashville, Tenn., and produced by four-time Grammy winner Kebâ Moâ, the bluesÂ influenced album features guest appearances from Kenny Wayne Shepherd,Â RobbenÂ Ford and Kebâ Moâ.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             A trendingÂ theme in todayâs world is women overcoming obstacles and breaking through theÂ glass ceilings to reach the top. âLike It On Topâ celebrates those that takeÂ initiative,Â develop, inspire and motivate.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             But it alsoÂ credits the men who are motivated and enlightened enough to support women inÂ their quest to be their best versions of themselves. The first single, âLike ItÂ On Top,âÂ emphasizes that behind every strong, successful woman stands the manÂ that understands the importance of having women be leaders in society.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             And theÂ final track, the gentle âHoney Iâm Home,â gives a shout-out to an ever-growingÂ number of families in which men give up their careers to support a womanâsÂ career.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             âI hopeÂ that my music inspires others to motivate ladies all over the world to beÂ successful, energetic, empowered women on a mission, and to motivate men toÂ give them thatÂ chance,âÂ PopovicÂ says. âThe majority of women need to workÂ harder than men to prove themselves or need to cope with a feeling of constantÂ pressure to never make a mistakeÂ and be perfect. I believe that women no longerÂ only have the right to earn a living and to take care of themselves and theirÂ families.â
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             The recordÂ offers ten tracks on ten subjects, including breaking new ground, feeling goodÂ in her skin, taking charge, making choices, having the courage to escape anÂ abusiveÂ relationship and getting her life back on track.
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             Â âThe time has come to step it up,âÂ PopovicÂ says. âBecoming the outstanding leaders of tomorrow. Corner-office ladies inÂ business, politics, and the electric guitar!â
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             <strong>
              ABOUTÂ ANAÂ POPOVIC
             </strong>
            </p>
            <p class="p2">
             Called âoneÂ helluva a guitar-playerâ by Bruce Springsteen, Los Angeles-basedÂ AnaÂ has beenÂ nominated for six Blues Music Awards, and has appeared on the covers of VintageÂ Guitar and Guitar Player magazines. Her albums âCan You Stand The Heatâ andÂ âUnconditionalâ where USA Today Picks-Of-The-Week and featured on NPR Music.Â Nearly all ofÂ Ana's albums reached the top of the Billboard Blues Charts. SheÂ and her six-piece band have toured tirelessly, sharing stages with B.B. King,Â Buddy Guy, Jeff Beck, JoeÂ Bonamassa and many others.
            </p>
